comments:
build i1216:2000
linux-gtk
jdk 1.4.2

I started up today's build on an old workspace (last used with build i1119). It
was majorly out of sync with the repository (since all the Equinox runtime
changes have occurred since then) so I hit "Update All" in the Sync view. After
doing some of the updates, I got the following errors in my log file. (I got 2
of them)

I got this same problem today after installing build i0129 and trying to "update
all".

Hitting the "update all" action multiple times eventually allowed me to catch up
to the repository.

DJ got this again. Somehow, an extra slash got in the resource sync info for 
several directories of the org.eclipse.core.boot project. He doesn't use an 
external client so a code inspection should reveal where this is occurring. It 
could be related to directory pruning as the directories involved where empty. 
Also, the error shoudl be improvide to show the failing resource and the 
malformed entry itself.

Actually, the extra slash is handled gracefully. This problem was caused by 
assuming the sync bytes were for a file when they could be for a folder as 
well. The appropriate checks have been added to 
SynchronizerSyncInfoCache.setCachedSyncBytes. Fix released to HEAD.
